About
Our Mission Statement:
“To enrich community spirit through educational, cultural and social gatherings in our historic Community House.”
Curtis Perry
The Early Days
Part-time Captiva resident Curtis Perry, of Brunswick, Maine, walked the length of Captiva and Sanibel and convinced residents a community center was needed. Going door to door, he not only got them to believe in the idea, he asked them to contribute money, labor, and materials to make the center a reality. Perry was a confirmed bachelor and resident artist.
The Community House is considered to be “The Heart of the Island”, with its rich history of serving islanders as both a gathering place for island activities as well as a rental space for private events. Built in 1927, The land upon which the SCA sits was donated by one of Sanibel’s original residents, Cordie Nutt. Keeping The Community House in service to the community is a Sacred Trust carried on by the board of directors.
History is rich within the walls of The Community House. The Historic “Founder’s Room” has been open to the public since 1927. We invite you to stop in for a tour and see for yourself where it all began.
The Community House strives to become an eco-friendly home all the while keeping our commitment to honoring our rich history by preserving our historic rooms.​
wp:heading
About SCA Inc.
/wp:heading
wp:paragraph
The Sanibel Community Association (SCA) is an independent organization that operates “The Community House,” which not only serves as an event location but also offers rental space. The Community House is composed of 3 rooms that can be rented separately or altogether (the entire building). Churches, civic organizations, clubs, non-profits, and island families have used The Community House for their parties, weddings, fundraisers, and other special events. Located conveniently on the west end of Periwinkle near Dunlop Road, The Community House is the place to meet neighbors and friends!
/wp:paragraph
wp:paragraph
We invite you to be a contributing partner and help support events in our historic building, the only island venue that is uniquely Sanibel. There is always something happening at The Community House. Come join us and see!
/wp:paragraph
wp:paragraph
Sanibel Community Association Inc. EIN# 59-1060466
The Community House serves as the historical heart of the island. Any public, private, individual, or group is welcome.
/wp:paragraph
wp:heading
One of the First Non-Profits on the Island
/wp:heading
wp:paragraph
Since 1927, The Community House has served as the gathering place of the islands. Many social organizations, civic groups, and clubs that first found a home here at The Community House are still here to this day. Though the Sanibel Community Association and therefore the Community House is not part of the City of Sanibel government or properties, the city actually has its roots here; the famous referendum of 1974 that incorporated the City of Sanibel was held here. The historic Founder’s Room was also the meeting place for the very first City Council meetings. The Community House also hosts many large events and festivals including the Annual Shell Show and Festival. It is one of the largest and longest-running Shell-related shows in the world, and it funds a large portion of SCA’s operations within the community.
/wp:paragraph
The Community House
Welcome to the Sanibel Community Association. We are a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization governed by a volunteer board of directors. The funds we raise through membership dues, fundraisers, events, donations and room rental income are used to operate The Community House.
Established in 1927 as a local gathering place for all residents and visitors, The Community House was the birthplace for many civic groups and the incorporation of Sanibel as a city.

Support Us
How you can support the community house
The Community House is the islands’ “home” where friends and residents meet to socialize at events and programs presented by The Sanibel Community Association. The SCA is the non-profit organization that funds and directs the operation of our Community House.
We invite you to be part of an organization that supports the community with social events, programs and volunteer opportunities, as well as providing low fee rental space for all island non profits, service organizations, clubs… and much more.
Your membership enables The Community House to expand programs to meet the growing needs of the community, offer additional benefits to its members and provide affordable entertainment and education to the entire community.
Current Fees are Individual $50, Family $100 and Business $150. For those wishing to contribute at a higher level, patron memberships start at $250 per year.
Annual Membership is effective July 1 – June 30 of each year.
Join or renew today and be a part of our thriving community!
MEMBERSHIP BENEFITS:
access to member-only events
discounted class and special event rates
option for early sign-up and early ticket purchases for classes and special events
facility rentals (family, business, or patron level membership required)
free quarterly meeting in The Islander board room for business members
Donate Now
Become a Member
Sponsorship Opportunities
Volunteer
Things to know
After 90+ years, The Community House continues to stand in its original location and was recently updated in all areas of the facility.
104 organizations and over 100,000 people currently use The House for yearly activities.
We also host weddings, celebrations of life, fundraisers, and other special events. This is why it was vital that The House be brought up to date, both visually and functionally.
There is no public funding for The House. This is Your Community House and it has relied on and continues to rely on the support of islanders to survive!
Unique programming revolving around the theme of culinary education, youth programs, and more need your support!
We are a 501 (c)3 and rely solely on donations, our events, membership, and facility usage fees.
We are not subsidized by any government agency.
Donate Today!
We invite you to support events in our historic building, the only island venue that is uniquely Sanibel. There is always something happening at The Community House.
Click Here to Donate!

Menu Home Shell Show & Festival Events Calendar Rentals Facility Overview Facility Use Information Plan Your Event Request A Booking Support Us Support Us Overview Become a Member Donate Online Volunteer About Us About Us Overview Board of Directors Staff News News Overview Newsletter Archive Subscribe to Newsletter Gallery Contact Us Get in touch Submit the form on the contact page , or reach out using one of the methods below. kristin@sanibelcommunityhouse.net (239) 472-2155 2173 Periwinkle Way Sanibel, FL 33957 Plan Your Event sidebar layout
The Community House is available to all members of the Sanibel Community Association for private events and functions. With its central location, convenient parking for guests, welcoming entrance patio, modern sound system & technical capability, large & flexible interior space, and a warm, inviting ambiance, The Community House will provide a charming setting for your event. Its well-equipped, commercial-level kitchen provides a caterer-friendly workspace to serve your guests. Originally built in 1927 as Sanibel’s first community gathering place, The Community House has been expanded over the years and completely renovated several years ago, retaining its original “Old Florida” style. Available rooms range from small to grand, so you can tailor the space to fit your needs and event budget. Moveable sound-proof walls allow for multiple events to happen at the same time; or by opening up the walls you can create one large open space of 5,750 square feet, the largest gathering place on the Island. The only limitation is your creativity! (As one example, a wedding ceremony could be held in one room, followed by dinner in another room, followed by music and dancing in a third room—all in one location.) For those requiring even more space, large events at The Community House can extend to the grounds surrounding the building. Parking areas on the East, South & West sides can be used for outdoor exhibits such as art shows, arts & craft fairs, industrial exhibits, etc. (In these instances, event attendees use The Community House parking lot on the Northside of Periwinkle Way.) Rental rates at The Community House are reasonable compared to other venues. Tables and chairs are available on-site and included in your rental, as are set-up and break-down services. In addition, linen service is available at a nominal rate. A Sanibel Community Association family, business or patron level membership is required to rent the facility. Memberships run for a fixed period, July 1 through June 30. click here to become a member Rental rates vary depending on the time of year, specific dates, space, and equipment needs, and the amount of time required for your event. Please call 239-472-2155 for current information. Donate Today! We invite you to support events in our historic building, the only island venue that is uniquely Sanibel. There is always something happening at The Community House. Click Here to Donate!
